content.description: Starts out on the right side of the Middle Triplet and follows the bolts up steeper terrain to anchors.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the Middle Triplet on the East Face

climbs.name: Shelter from the Storm
climbs.fa: Bob Ordner, Eric Barrett, & Rusty Baillie 2011

content.description: Climbs the slightly overhanging features of the South Triplet with good holds to the anchors at the top.
content.location: Middle of the South Triplet on the East face.

climbs.name: Passages
climbs.fa: Bob Ordner, Eric Barrett, Rusty Baillie 2011

content.description: Scramble up the blocks to the top of the saddle between the South and Middle Triplet.  Then climb the obvious crack with good gear and bolts to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 3" plus a couple bolts.  Anchors at top.
content.location: Between the South and Middle Triplet on the East Face.

content.description: This is a nice arete route. Don’t get bewildered by the last couple of moves! Shares an anchor with Shelter from the Storm.
content.location: The NE Corner of South Triplet, about 15 feet right of Shelter From the Storm.

climbs.name: Legacy
climbs.fa: Bob Ordner, Rusty Baillie, Adam Volwiler, Andrew Pearson 2011

content.description: Starts to the right of "Counter Transference" on the Southeast corner of the North Triplet.  Follow the off-width crack to a large horizontal break on the face before switching to the  crack to the right that leads up to a bolted ledge.
content.protection: Gear to 4" with a couple of large stoppers.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: Southeast corner of the Northern Triplet.

content.description: Starts near the center of Middle Triplet and ascends the left leaning crack to a bulge and up an arete.
content.protection: Gear to 3" plus a few bolts.

climbs.name: Counter Transference
climbs.fa: Bob Ordner, Rusty Baillie, Andrew Pearson, Adam Volwiler 2011

content.description: Starts on the left side of the North Triplet.  Follows the obvious arete to a chimney and the anchors.
content.location: The left side of the North Triplet on the East Face.

content.description: Starts on "Shelter from the Storm" then traverses up and left onto the South face and follows the obvious crack to the anchors of "Shelter from the Storm".
content.protection: Gear to 2" plus a couple bolts to anchors at top.
content.location: South Triplet on the East Face
